channel.title: [PI] (317) Tyreatta - Client Error
channel.description:
Hello there, I use eclipse and I just recently started working a little on tyreatta and I can't really run the client. Running into an issue here... I saw at first that the cachedownloader isn't really working, so I fixed it. Now it's working fine but not unpacking, I also fixed it. Then, I just decided to unpack the Cache manually and place it in (users.home) where it's supposed to be...
Here's the error eclipse is giving me; [CODE] Error: loaderror Starting up 20 Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.cleanUpForQuit(client.java:5064) at RSApplet.exit(RSApplet.java:132) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:126) at client.run(client.java:4846) [/CODE] Here's a picture of what the client shows up as..... http://prntscr.com/71olq9
If anyone knows what's going on, please let me know... Thanks..

item.title: [PI] (317) Tyreatta - Client Error
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“beale, post:6, topic:551355”]Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException
Your issue is right there in plain text just read a lil more and you see where to find/fix the issue.

so go into client.java, do ctrl+g and search for line 5064; Try deleting that line, and that may work.[/quote]
I literally just said that…

Welliton_inc:

What is on line 5064 of your client class?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] (317) Tyreatta - Client Error
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

Your issue is right there in plain text just read a lil more and you see where to find/fix the issue.
[code]at client.cleanUpForQuit(client.java:5064)[/code]

so go into client.java, do ctrl+g and search for line 5064; Try deleting that line, and that may work.

Your issue is right there in plain text just read a lil more and you see where to find/fix the issue.

so go into client.java, do ctrl+g and search for line 5064; Try deleting that line, and that may work.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] (317) Tyreatta - Client Error
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:4, topic:551355”][quote author=Damoiscool link=topic=670272.msg4482053#msg4482053 date=1430831159]

Hello there, I use eclipse and I just recently started working a little on tyreatta and I can’t really run the client.
Running into an issue here… I saw at first that the cachedownloader isn’t really working, so I fixed it. Now it’s working fine but not unpacking, I also fixed it. Then, I just decided to unpack the Cache manually and place it in (users.home) where it’s supposed to be…

Here’s the error eclipse is giving me;

Error: loaderror Starting up 20 Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.cleanUpForQuit(client.java:5064) at RSApplet.exit(RSApplet.java:132) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:126) at client.run(client.java:4846)
Here’s a picture of what the client shows up as…
http://prntscr.com/71olq9

If anyone knows what’s going on, please let me know… Thanks…

Looks like its having trouble unpacking/loading the cache. I never should have released it, its terrible and to be honest has a lot of bugs I never got around to fixing. Like this one, after a few times of manually downloading the cache (link in CacheDownloader.java) and unpacking to the correct location, it randomly worked. Honestly I wouldn’t bother with it. If you plan to start a project this release will give you a lot of trouble. Its also not fully protected against the Reflection cheat client.
[/quote]

Alright thanks. I’ll change it up =p[/quote]

Sorry i couldnt have been more help. Havent worked on it for ages, tried to last week but it failed miserably so I just started on a almost blank pi sourerce and client

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] (317) Tyreatta - Client Error
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“Damoiscool, post:2, topic:551355”][quote author=malimt link=topic=670272.msg4482039#msg4482039 date=1430800057]
Hello there, I use eclipse and I just recently started working a little on tyreatta and I can’t really run the client.
Running into an issue here… I saw at first that the cachedownloader isn’t really working, so I fixed it. Now it’s working fine but not unpacking, I also fixed it. Then, I just decided to unpack the Cache manually and place it in (users.home) where it’s supposed to be…

Here’s the error eclipse is giving me;

Error: loaderror Starting up 20 Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.cleanUpForQuit(client.java:5064) at RSApplet.exit(RSApplet.java:132) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:126) at client.run(client.java:4846)
Here’s a picture of what the client shows up as…
http://prntscr.com/71olq9

If anyone knows what’s going on, please let me know… Thanks…
[/quote]

Looks like its having trouble unpacking/loading the cache. I never should have released it, its terrible and to be honest has a lot of bugs I never got around to fixing. Like this one, after a few times of manually downloading the cache (link in CacheDownloader.java) and unpacking to the correct location, it randomly worked. Honestly I wouldn’t bother with it. If you plan to start a project this release will give you a lot of trouble. Its also not fully protected against the Reflection cheat client.[/quote]

Alright thanks. I’ll change it up =p

Read full topic

item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:1, topic:551355”]Hello there, I use eclipse and I just recently started working a little on tyreatta and I can’t really run the client.
Running into an issue here… I saw at first that the cachedownloader isn’t really working, so I fixed it. Now it’s working fine but not unpacking, I also fixed it. Then, I just decided to unpack the Cache manually and place it in (users.home) where it’s supposed to be…

Here’s the error eclipse is giving me;

Error: loaderror Starting up 20 Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.cleanUpForQuit(client.java:5064) at RSApplet.exit(RSApplet.java:132) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:126) at client.run(client.java:4846)
Here’s a picture of what the client shows up as…
http://prntscr.com/71olq9

If anyone knows what’s going on, please let me know… Thanks…[/quote]

Looks like its having trouble unpacking/loading the cache. I never should have released it, its terrible and to be honest has a lot of bugs I never got around to fixing. Like this one, after a few times of manually downloading the cache (link in CacheDownloader.java) and unpacking to the correct location, it randomly worked. Honestly I wouldn’t bother with it. If you plan to start a project this release will give you a lot of trouble. Its also not fully protected against the Reflection cheat client.
